drive

extends java.lang.Object

    • Field Detail

      • leftDrive

        public static edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SpeedController leftDrive
        The motor controller responsible for the left drive motor.

      • rightDrive

        public static edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SpeedController rightDrive
        The motor controller responsible for the right drive motor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DriveTrain

        public DriveTrain(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SpeedController leftDriveMotor,
                  edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SpeedController rightDriveMotor)
        Public Constructor for the Drivetrain class. This initializes the values of the left and right drive motors. The motors are stored as speed controller objects, so we don't have to have a constructor for each type of motor controller.
        Parameters:
        leftDriveMotor - The motor responsible for the left side of the drivetrain.
        rightDriveMotor - The motor responsible for the right side of the drivetrain.

    • Method Detail

      • setInverted

        public static void setInverted(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SpeedController motor,
                               boolean inverted)
        This method sets the inverted state of one of the motors. Right now, that can be called by calling the instance of the motor to be inverted.
        Parameters:
        motor - The motor to be inverted.
        inverted - The inverted state to be set to. True will invert the motor, False will keep the motor in normal position.

      • set

        public static void set(double value)
        This method sets both of the motors to the same value. This can be used when in autonomous and you want to set both motors to the same when you have one drivetrain PID class.
        Parameters:
        value - The PWM value to set the motor to.

      • set

        public static void set(double leftValue,
                       double rightValue)
        This method can be used to set both of the motors to different values. This is highly useful when the robot is in teleoperated mode.
        Parameters:
        leftValue - The value that the left motor should be set to.
        rightValue - The value that the right motor should be set to.

      • set

        public static void set(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Joystick leftStick,
                       edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Joystick rightStick)
        This method can be used to set the motor values with joysticks. This calls the getY() function, so any inverting should be done before this function is called.
        Parameters:
        leftStick - The joystick responsible for the left side of the drivetrain.
        rightStick - The joystick responsible for the right side of the drivetrain.

      • turnSet

        public static void turnSet(double value)
        This method can be used in conjunction with drivetrain PID systems. It will set the values of the motors to opposites to ensure turning.
        Parameters:
        value -
